Question_1.Context: Wearable electronic devices require a flexible and wearable electricity supply source. Triboelectric nanogenerators (TENGs) can convert mechanical energy into electrical energy through contact and separation of different materials.
Question_1.Question: What is the main function of a triboelectric nanogenerator (TENG)?
Question_1.B: To convert mechanical energy into electrical energy
Question_1.C: To measure the amount of electrical energy
Question_1.Source: Among them, triboelectric nanogenerator (TENG) and piezoelectric nanogenerator (PENG), which produce electrical energy from external mechanical stimulation, are receiving considerable attention.

Question_2.Context: In the context of wearable electronics, the flexibility and durability of energy harvesting devices are crucial for their integration into clothing and other wearable items.
Question_2.Question: Why is flexibility important for energy harvesters used in wearable electronics?
Question_2.A: To increase the storage capacity of the device
Question_2.B: To improve the aesthetic appeal of the device
Question_2.C: To allow the device to withstand bending and twisting motions
Question_2.D: To enhance the electrical conductivity of the device
Question_2.Source: The fabricated TENG is flexible and bendable; therefore, it is suitable for wearables; it is easy to connect the copper electrode inside the fiber to electronic devices.

Question_3.Context: Textile-type triboelectric nanogenerators (T-TENGs) can be made using various methods, including knitting and weaving, to incorporate them into wearable textiles.
Question_3.Question: Which manufacturing methods are suitable for creating textile-type triboelectric nanogenerators (T-TENGs)?
Question_3.Source: A large area T-TENG can be woven or knit using this fiber.

Question_4.Context: The performance of triboelectric nanogenerators can be affected by the force applied during the contact and separation of triboelectric materials.
Question_4.Question: What happens to the voltage output of a triboelectric nanogenerator when the force applied to it is increased?
Question_4.Source: As the force increased from 5 to 40 N, the voltage output of the T-TENG increased from ~ 100 V to ~ 250 V.

Question_5.Context: The output power density of an energy harvesting device is a critical parameter that determines its efficiency and suitability for powering electronic devices.
Question_5.Question: What was the output power density of the fabricated textile-type triboelectric nanogenerator (T-TENG)?
Question_5.Source: The T-TENG has an energy harvesting capability that not only has an output power density of ~ 0.36 W/m2.

Question_6.Context: The durability of triboelectric nanogenerators in various environmental conditions is essential for their practical application in wearable devices.
Question_6.Question: What property of Teflon contributes to the durability of T-TENGs in harsh environments?
Question_6.Source: Owing to the water repellency and chemical resistance of Teflon, there was little change in the surface after immersion compared to that before immersion.

Question_7.Context: The output of a triboelectric nanogenerator can be affected by the frequency of the mechanical stimulation applied to it.
Question_7.Question: How does the output voltage of a T-TENG change with an increase in frequency of mechanical stimulation?
Question_7.B: It increases up to a certain frequency and then stabilizes
Question_7.C: It remains constant regardless of frequency
Question_7.Source: It was established that the output voltage increased to 3 Hz and then stabilized.

Question_8.Context: The electrical output of a triboelectric nanogenerator can be characterized by measuring the output voltage and current under different external resistances.
Question_8.Question: What happens to the output voltage and current of a T-TENG when the external resistance is increased?
Question_8.A: Both output voltage and current increase
Question_8.B: Output voltage increases and output current decreases
Question_8.C: Output voltage decreases and output current increases
Question_8.D: Both output voltage and current decrease
Question_8.Source: As the external resistance increased, the output voltage of the T-TENG increased and the output current decreased.

Question_9.Context: The ability of a triboelectric nanogenerator to maintain its performance over repeated mechanical stimuli is an indicator of its durability and reliability.
Question_9.Question: What was observed about the performance of the T-TENG after repeated contact-separation cycles?
Question_9.Source: The relative output voltage (V/VF) did not change significantly when the contact-separation was cycled 2500 times.

Question_10.Context: The practical application of a triboelectric nanogenerator includes its ability to charge capacitors, which can then power electronic devices.
Question_10.Question: What was demonstrated by charging a capacitor with the T-TENG?
Question_10.A: The T-TENG can power a calculator for a short duration
Question_10.B: The T-TENG can only charge capacitors with very low capacitance
Question_10.C: The T-TENG can only generate alternating current (AC)
Question_10.D: The T-TENG is not suitable for powering electronic devices
Question_10.Source: By connecting a 4.7 μF capacitor charged over 2 V with the T-TENG to the calculator, the calculator was able to perform simple additions and multiplications for ~ 8 s.
